clinical_study.brief_title: Compare the Efficacy of Levocetirizine and Montelukast to Placebo in Reducing Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis (SAR) Symptoms in Ragweed Sensitive Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Double-blind, Three Parallel Randomized Groups, Therapeutic Confirmatory Clinical Trial to Compare the Efficacy of Oral Levocetirizine 5 mg and Montelukast 10 mg to Placebo in Reducing Symptoms of Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis (SAR) in Ragweed Sensitive Subjects Exposed to Ragweed Pollen in an Environmental Exposure Unit (EEU)

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the clinical efficacy of levocetirizine 5 mg and montelukast 10 mg on symptoms of seasonal allergic rhinitis occurring in subjects exposed to ragweed pollen in an environmental exposure unit.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Major Symptom Complex (MSC) Score Over Period I
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
primary_outcome.description: Six individual symptoms which are most dominant in the rhinitis symptom profile will be combined to form the MSC severity score: Runny nose (right and left), itchy nose (right and left), sniffles, nose blows, sneezes, watery eyes. Each individual symptom, except nose blows and sneezes, is rated on a 5-point scale of severity: 0 = None, 1 = a little, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Quite a bit, 4 = severe, 5 = very severe. For nose blows and sneezes, the subjects had to record the number of each symptom since last evaluation. This number corresponds to a score ranging from 0 to 8. The total MSC score ranges from 0 - 36. Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity. Negative values indicate improvement from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Total Symptom Complex (TSC) Score Over Period I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
secondary_outcome.description: The TSC score was calculated as the sum of the following 10 individual symptom scores: runny nose (left and right), itchy nose (left and right), sniffles, nose blows, sneezes, watery eyes, itchy eyes and ears, itchy throat, cough and postnasal drip. Each individual symptom, except nose blows and sneezes, is rated on a 5-point scale of severity: 0 = None, 1 = a little, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Quite a bit, 4 = severe, 5 = very severe. For nose blows and sneezes, the subjects had to record the number of each symptom since last evaluation. This number corresponds to a score ranging from 0 to 8. The TSC score ranges from 0 to 56. Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity. Negative values indicate improvement from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the TSC Score + Nasal Congestion Score Over Period I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
secondary_outcome.description: The TSC score was calculated as the sum of the following 10 individual symptom scores: runny nose (left and right), itchy nose (left and right), sniffles, nose blows, sneezes, watery eyes, itchy eyes and ears, itchy throat, cough and postnasal drip. Each individual symptom, except nose blows and sneezes, is rated on a 5-point scale of severity: 0 = None, 1 = a little, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Quite a bit, 4 = severe, 5 = very severe. For nose blows and sneezes, the subjects had to record the number of each symptom since last evaluation. This number corresponds to a score ranging from 0 to 8. The Nasal congestion score ranged from 0 to 4 (0 = clear, 1 = slight block, 2 = stuffy, 3 = very stuffy, 4 = blocked). It corresponds to the mean value of right nostril and left nostril. The TSC score plus Nasal congestion score was added and ranged from 0 to 60. Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity. Negative values indicate improvement from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Individual Symptom Scores Over Period I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
secondary_outcome.description: Individual symptom scores include Runny Nose Score, Itchy Nose Score, Sniffles Score, Postnasal Drip Score, Watery Eyes Score, Itchy Eyes and Ears Score, Itchy Throat Score, Cough Score, Sneezes Score, Nose Blows Score, Nasal Congestion Score. The subjects had to evaluate the severity of the symptoms using a scale from "None" to "Very severe" (ranging from 0 to 5). For Sneezes Score and Nose Blows Score, the subjects had to record the number of each symptom since last evaluation. This number corresponds to a score ranging from 0 to 8. The Nasal congestion score ranged from 0 to 4 (0 = clear, 1 = slight block, 2 = stuffy, 3 = very stuffy, 4 = blocked). It corresponds to the mean value of right nostril and left nostril. Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity. Negative values indicate improvement from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Feeling of Improvement During Period I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
secondary_outcome.description: During Period I, the subjects had to record the moment (hh:mm) of first feeling of improvement (compared to Baseline intensity of symptoms).

secondary_outcome.measure: Onset of Action During Period I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
secondary_outcome.description: The onset of action was defined as the first time point during Period I after initiation of the treatment when the reduction from Baseline in the MSC score for the active treatment group became statistically different from the placebo group and when this significant change was maintained for some period of time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity of Action From Baseline in the MSC Score Over Period I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of action was measured by the percentage of subjects with categorized percentage change from Baseline in the MSC score over Period I. Categories are defined as following: < 20%, >=20%, < 50%, >=50%, < 70%, >=70% change from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity of Action From Baseline in the MSC Score Over Period II
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment Period II [Day 2, from 9:30 am to 11:00 am]
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of action was measured by the percentage of subjects with categorized percentage change from Baseline in the MSC score over Period II. Categories are defined as following: < 20%, >=20%, < 50%, >=50%, < 70%, >=70% change from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity of Action From Baseline in the MSC Score Over Period III
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment Period III [Day 2, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 3:30 pm]
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of action was measured by the percentage of subjects with categorized percentage change from Baseline in the MSC score over Period III. Categories are defined as following: < 20%, >=20%, < 50%, >=50%, < 70%, >=70% change from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Variability of Action From Baseline in the MSC Score Over Period I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
secondary_outcome.description: The variability of action was assessed by the percentage of distribution of the percentage change from Baseline in the MSC score. Categories are defined as following: < 20%, 20%-35%, 35%-50%, 50%-65%, 65%-80%, >=80%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Variability of Action From Baseline in the MSC Score Over Period II
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment Period II [Day 2, from 9:30 am to 11:00 am]
secondary_outcome.description: The variability of action was assessed by the percentage of distribution of the percentage change from Baseline in the MSC score. Categories are defined as following: < 20%, 20%-35%, 35%-50%, 50%-65%, 65%-80%, >=80%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Variability of Action From Baseline in the MSC Score Over Period III
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment Period III [Day 2, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 3:30 pm]
secondary_outcome.description: The variability of action was assessed by the percentage of distribution of the percentage change from Baseline in the MSC score. Categories are defined as following: < 20%, 20%-35%, 35%-50%, 50%-65%, 65%-80%, >=80%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Satisfaction of the Subjects at the End of Period III
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of Period III (Day 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Global satisfaction was evaluated at the end of Period III by the subject on a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 (very dissatisfied) to 100 mm (very satisfied).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects, at the End of Period III Who Are Willing to Take the Same Medication During the Next Pollen Season
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of Period III (Day 2)
secondary_outcome.description: At the end of Period III, each subject without reference to the Symptom Diary Card (SDC) answered to the question: "Do you want to take the same treatment during the next pollen season?" (yes or no).

arm_group.description: Placebo was administered orally on Days 1 and 2.
10 mg of Montelukast (MLKT) was administered orally on Days 1 and 2.
5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was administered orally on Days 1 and 2.

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical form: Over-encapsulated tablet Route of administration: Oral use
Pharmaceutical form: Over-encapsulated tablet Concentration: 10 mg Route of administration: Oral use
Pharmaceutical form: Over-encapsulated tablet Concentration: 5 mg Route of administration: Oral use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have had seasonal allergic rhinitis due to Ragweed for the last 2 consecutive years
- Subjects who obtain a minimum sum score, considering Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis (SAR) related symptoms (mean value), as defined by the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any clinically significant condition that might interfere with the treatment evaluation, both for efficacy and safety
- Have used forbidden concomitant medications as defined by the protocol

For nose blows and sneezes, the subjects had to record the number of each symptom since last evaluation. This number corresponds to a score ranging from 0 to 8. The total MSC score ranges from 0 - 36. Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity. Negative values indicate improvement from Baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Day 2
outcome.population: Only patients with valid MSC scores during the Total Treatment Period were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the TSC Score + Nasal Congestion Score Over Period I
outcome.description: The TSC score was calculated as the sum of the following 10 individual symptom scores: runny nose (left and right), itchy nose (left and right), sniffles, nose blows, sneezes, watery eyes, itchy eyes and ears, itchy throat, cough and postnasal drip. Each individual symptom, except nose blows and sneezes, is rated on a 5-point scale of severity: 0 = None, 1 = a little, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Quite a bit, 4 = severe, 5 = very severe. For nose blows and sneezes, the subjects had to record the number of each symptom since last evaluation. This number corresponds to a score ranging from 0 to 8. The Nasal congestion score ranged from 0 to 4 (0 = clear, 1 = slight block, 2 = stuffy, 3 = very stuffy, 4 = blocked). It corresponds to the mean value of right nostril and left nostril. The TSC score plus Nasal congestion score was added and ranged from 0 to 60. Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity. Negative values indicate improvement from Baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
outcome.population: Only patients with valid TSC score + Nasal congestion score in Period I were included in the analysis.

Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity. Negative values indicate improvement from Baseline.

The subjects had to evaluate the severity of the symptoms using a scale from "None" to "Very severe" (ranging from 0 to 5). For Sneezes Score and Nose Blows Score, the subjects had to record the number of each symptom since last evaluation. This number corresponds to a score ranging from 0 to 8. The Nasal congestion score ranged from 0 to 4 (0 = clear, 1 = slight block, 2 = stuffy, 3 = very stuffy, 4 = blocked). It corresponds to the mean value of right nostril and left nostril. Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity. Negative values indicate improvement from Baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Day 2
outcome.population: Only patients with valid individual symptom scores during the Total Treatment Period were included in the analysis.

group.title: Placebo (PBO)
group.description: Placebo was administered orally on Days 1 and 2.

group.title: Levocetirizine (LCTZ)
group.description: 5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was administered orally on Days 1 and 2.

group.title: Montelukast (MLKT)
group.description: 10 mg of Montelukast (MLKT) was administered orally on Days 1 and 2.

outcome.title: Time to First Feeling of Improvement During Period I
outcome.description: During Period I, the subjects had to record the moment (hh:mm) of first feeling of improvement (compared to Baseline intensity of symptoms).
outcome.time_frame: During Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]
outcome.population: Subjects with no first feeling of improvement were censored at 300 minutes.

outcome.title: Onset of Action During Period I
outcome.description: The onset of action was defined as the first time point during Period I after initiation of the treatment when the reduction from Baseline in the MSC score for the active treatment group became statistically different from the placebo group and when this significant change was maintained for some period of time.
outcome.time_frame: During Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]

measure.title: Onset of Action During Period I
measure.description: The onset of action was defined as the first time point during Period I after initiation of the treatment when the reduction from Baseline in the MSC score for the active treatment group became statistically different from the placebo group and when this significant change was maintained for some period of time.

outcome.title: Intensity of Action From Baseline in the MSC Score Over Period I
outcome.description: The intensity of action was measured by the percentage of subjects with categorized percentage change from Baseline in the MSC score over Period I. Categories are defined as following: < 20%, >=20%, < 50%, >=50%, < 70%, >=70% change from Baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Treatment Period 1 [Day 1, from drug intake (at 11:00 am) to 5 hours post-treatment (at 4:00 pm)]

outcome.description: The variability of action was assessed by the percentage of distribution of the percentage change from Baseline in the MSC score. Categories are defined as following: < 20%, 20%-35%, 35%-50%, 50%-65%, 65%-80%, >=80%.

outcome.title: Global Satisfaction of the Subjects at the End of Period III
outcome.description: Global satisfaction was evaluated at the end of Period III by the subject on a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 (very dissatisfied) to 100 mm (very satisfied).
outcome.time_frame: At the end of Period III (Day 2)
outcome.population: Only subjects with valid data for Global Satisfaction (VAS Score) were included in the analysis.

measure.population: Only subjects with valid data for Global Satisfaction (VAS Score) were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects, at the End of Period III Who Are Willing to Take the Same Medication During the Next Pollen Season
outcome.description: At the end of Period III, each subject without reference to the Symptom Diary Card (SDC) answered to the question: "Do you want to take the same treatment during the next pollen season?" (yes or no).
outcome.time_frame: At the end of Period III (Day 2)
outcome.population: Only subjects with valid data were included in the analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were recorded in Study Phase II and in Study Phase III (Day 1 and Day 2), before and after each pollen exposure.
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events refer to the Safety Population consisting of all subjects who were dispensed medication.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
